p: Since the outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS)-CoV-2 or COVID-19 coronavirus started in China in December 2019, there is increasing evidence that those with existing comorbidities, older age or a compromised immune system are at higher risk of developing severe and even fatal respiratory diseases [ 1]. Cancer and transplant patients are also considered to be in this risk group [ 2, 3], especially as they may be treated with immune-suppressive or immune-stimulating drugs.
